page.title: 16BALLIDON - small village
page.content:
Population of 60 - within the Peak Park it has a church, farms, cottages and a quarry. With the growth of the latter only 5 farms remain,these were built in Georgian times, one was moated,formley the hall it has four storeys. The fireplaces were originally in the centre of the house the once thatched roof bears marks of the sharpening of tools. There is still panelling in the upper rooms and down the staircase. The only new additions this century are four council houses and one bungalow.
Social life centres round the church with fund raising efforts for charities and church. Annual sheepdog trails are held at Ballidon.
